title: Cannot add more than 40 records from csv file for annotation
body:
```python
import rubrix as rb
import pandas as pd

#take any data with more than 40 text rows
df=pd.read_csv("../data/_data(top1000rows).csv")

for input_text in df['identified-text']:
    if not input_text:
        continue
    input_text=str(input_text)
    rb.log(
        rb.TokenClassificationRecord(
            text=input_text,
            tokens=input_text.split()),
        name='ner-label'
        )
```
![Screenshot (24)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46840328/141049863-4e6f04c1-e4e3-4a72-b057-6dc2b38b0337.png)

title: [METRICS] metrics related to mentions should be accesibles for annotated info

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
Only metrics related to predicted mentions are exposed in API. It's should be nice to have similar metrics for annotations when possible.

From client side, we have 2 possibilities:

- Replicate current methods for annotations: `annotated_mentions(....)`, `annotated_entity_labels`...
- Passing a parameter for annotation/prediction to current metrics (`entity_consistency(target="prediction")`,  `mentions_length(target="annotations")`

@dcfidalgo @dvsrepo Feedback welcome

title: Limit metadata field name pattern

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
-  only lower_case alphabet  `[a-z]`
- only underscore `_` and dot `.` as special characters
- non digits allowed

These restrictions will help to dynamically tackle metadata info for example for advances queries or aggregations.

what do you think @dcfidalgo @dvsrepo ?

title: fix: enable nested fields in search dsl
body:
With this PR you can use single nested fields in query string dsl:

For example, for token classification datasets, you can query things like:
```python
"metrics.mentions.predicted.mention: first"
```

For now, combining nested fields for same group is not yet supported since specific nature of nested fields

Fixes #586

title: Nested fields should be accessible from query syntax dsl. At least individually

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Logging records in rubrix including metadata field in form:

````python
record = ...., metadata={ 
    "composed": [ 
        { 
            "key": "My key", 
            "value": "the value" 
        }
    ]
})
````

will automatically create elasticsearch [nested fields](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/nested.html)

Those fields are not searchables from advanced query string use:

```python
"metadata.composed.key: My key"
```

A basic query filtering must be supported.

title: [Bug] rb.load fails for datasets with the same name but different tasks

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
When creating, loading, deleting a dataset, and afterward creating a new one with the same name but a different task, `rb.load` will fail:
```python
dataset = "test_delete_and_create_for_different_task"
text = "This is a text"
​
rubrix.delete(dataset)
rubrix.log(TextClassificationRecord(id=0, inputs=text), name=dataset)
rubrix.load(dataset)
​
rubrix.delete(dataset)
rubrix.log(
    TokenClassificationRecord(id=0, text=text, tokens=text.split(" ")), name=dataset
)
rubrix.load(dataset)

# Output
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/david/recognai/rubrix/tests/client/bug.py", line 52, in <module>
    rb.load(dataset)
  File "/home/david/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/__init__.py", line 194, in load
    return _client_instance().load(
  File "/home/david/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/client/rubrix_client.py", line 267, in load
    _check_response_errors(response)
  File "/home/david/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/client/rubrix_client.py", line 373, in _check_response_errors
    raise Exception(
Exception: Request error: API cannot answer. The API answered with a 400 code: detail='Provided task TextClassification cannot be applied to dataset'
```

title: [Bug] `rb.load` fails when record ids are str and int

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Fails because it cannot sort them:
```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-40-8967ccc9dc03> in <module>
----> 1 rb.load("weak_supervision_yt")

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/__init__.py in load(name, query, ids, limit, as_pandas)
    192         >>> dataframe = rb.load(name="example-dataset")
    193     """
--> 194     return _client_instance().load(
    195         name=name, query=query, limit=limit, ids=ids, as_pandas=as_pandas
    196     )

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/client/rubrix_client.py in load(self, name, query, ids, limit, as_pandas)
    267         _check_response_errors(response)
    268 
--> 269         records_sorted_by_id = sorted(
    270             [record.to_client() for record in response.parsed], key=lambda x: x.id
    271         )

TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'str'
```

title: Remove dynamic metadata, move it to `setup.cfg`

No need to have our package metadata duplicated, moved everything to the static `setup.cfg`.

Also, set the flag of using scm in the `pyproject.toml`. pip 21.3 now supports editable installs with `pyproject.toml`, so at some point, we might want to get rid of the `setup.py` file.

title: versions for stable documentation are wrong

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
Stable and master versions titles in read the docs shows dirty or wrong version numbers.


Maybe this could help (from [setuptools-scm readme](https://github.com/pypa/setuptools_scm/#usage-from-sphinx))

> ## Usage from Sphinx
> It is discouraged to use setuptools_scm from Sphinx itself, instead use importlib.metadata after editable/real installation:
> 
> 
> ```python
> # contents of docs/conf.py
> from importlib.metadata import version
> release = version('myproject')
> # for example take major/minor
> version = '.'.join(release.split('.')[:2])
> ```
> 
> The underlying reason is, that services like Read the Docs sometimes change the working directory for good reasons and using the installed metadata prevents using needless volatile data there.

title: Question: remove record attributes should be allowed ?

labels.name: status: question
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request needs more information

body:
In rubrix, after logging some records, you can change record attributes but you cannot remove them.

For example, you can change a record prediction but you cannot remote it. Should we support this kind of updates? Is this behavior a bug?

By other hand, this new behaviour could difficult partial updates, and you should send the whole data record each time

@dvsrepo @dcfidalgo

title: Prediction agent not read from client info

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Logging records in rubrix with prediction agent info doesn't not stored properly for token classification:

```python
doc = nlp("This is my text")
entities = [(ent.label_, ent.start_char, ent.end_char) for ent in doc.ents]
record = TokenClassificationRecord(
        text=doc.text,
        tokens=[t.text for t in doc],
        metadata=metadata or {},
        prediction_agent="my_agent",
        prediction=entities,
)

assert record.prediction_agent == "my_agent" # -> this will fail
```

title: Feat: Enhance `rubrix.load`
body:
This PR does 3 things to `rubrix.load()`:
- Sorts the records by id before returning them
- Adds an `as_pandas` parameter that controls the output type: or a pandas DataFrame, or simply a list of records (default: True)
- Adds a `query` parameter that allows one to filter the records with an ES DSL string (default: None)

In Annotation mode, it is the other way around. @leiyre Not sure if this behavior is desired or if it is a bug.

title: feat(client): support auto-monitor for spaCy and text-class transformers
body:
This PR introduces a client mechanism for transparently monitor model predictions.

This feature is only available for spacy NER  and transformers for text classification pipelines:

Following a example of use:

```python
import spacy
import rubrix as rb

nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_sm")
nlp = rb.monitor(nlp, dataset="spacy-ner-monitoring", sample_rate=1.0)

nlp("You just use your spaCy model as always")
# After that, records for token classification should be logged in `spacy-ner-monitoring` rubrix dataset


# You can use also with transformers:
from transformers import pipeline

sentiment_classifier = pipeline(
    model="distilbert-base-uncased-finetuned-sst-2-english",
    task="sentiment-analysis"
)

sentiment_classifier = rb.monitor(
    sentiment_classifier, dataset="text-classifier", sample_rate=0.5
)

sentiment_classifier("This is a text, yeah")
#  or
sentiment_classifier(["This is a text", "And another text here"])

```

QUESTION: Global actions validation for text classification with multi label
body:
Making annotations for multi class text classification dataset I've realized that using global action for group validation ("Annotate as..." action) doesn't work like I've expected.

Selecting labels from global actions should totally overwrite labels for selected records. Instead of that, the selected labels are merged with already defined in records.

What would be the appropriate behavior  in this case @dvsrepo @dcfidalgo @Amelie-V @leiyre ?

title: Rubrix with Amazon OpenSearch Service?
body:
Hello! This project looks great and I'm excited to try it out for our use case.

Do you know if Rubrix is compatible with the Amazon OpenSearch Service? I'm currently using that for my project since it's convenient with AWS. I've run into issues recently with the python `elasticsearch` client saying that opensearch is no longer supported, and I feel like that could be a problem with this as well.

Thank you!
